Author: SEXi
Description: Chilean data center and hosting provider IxMetro Powerhost suffers a cyberattack at the hands of a new ransomware gang known as SEXi, which encrypts the company's VMware ESXi servers and backups.

Author: Hunters International
Description: Hoya Corporation, one of the largest global manufacturers of optical products, says a "system failure" caused servers at some of its production plants and business divisions to go offline. The Hunters International ransomware gang claims responsibility for the attack and demands a $10M ransom.
Researchers from AhnLab discover a malicious campaign using a Google Ad statistical feature to embed URLs that distribute malware, including the Rhadamanthys stealer.

Author: Bignosa and Gods
Target: Multiple organizations in America and Australia
Description: Researchers from Check Point uncovered a malware campaign distributing the Agent Tesla malware against American and Australian organizations.

Author: Earth Freybug (subset of APT41, a.k.a. Axiom, Brass Typhoon - formerly Barium -, Bronze Atlas, HOODOO, Wicked Panda, and Winnti)
Description: Researchers from Trend Micro discover a threat activity cluster tracked as Earth Freybug using a new malware called UNAPIMON to fly under the radar.

Jackson County, Missouri, declares a state of emergency and closes key offices indefinitely as it responds to what officials believe is a ransomware attack that has made some of its IT systems inoperable.
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security

Description: Researchers from Sucuri discover a new variant of the Magento Shoplift malware targeting both WordPress and Magento CMS.
Researchers from McAfee discover a new Pikabot campaign leveraging various file types, including HTML, Javascript, and Excel, to breach security defenses.

Author: The Com'
Description: Researchers at Intel471 discover a widespread phishing campaign carried out by a community of English-speaking threat actors dubbed 'The Com'.

Author: TA558
Description: Researchers from Perception Point discover a new phishing campaign by the threat actor TA558 targeting a wide range of sectors in Latin America with the goal of deploying Venom RAT.
Cancer treatment and research center City of Hope warns that a data breach exposed the sensitive information of over 820,000 patients.

Target: New York City Automated Personnel System, Employee Self Service (known as NYCAPS/ESS)
Description: The city of New York took its payroll website partially offline for the last nine days in response to a recent phishing scheme targeting city employees
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security

Description: Diabetes WA discloses a data breach affecting people who engaged with its telehealth service.

Author: BianLian
Description: On Q Financial discloses a breach due to the ScreenConnect CVE-2024-1709 and CVE-2024-1708 vulnerabilities. The BianLian ransomware group claims responsibility for the attack.

Author: Medusa
Description: The East Baton Rouge Sheriff's Office is hit with a ransomware attack. The Medusa group claims responsibility.
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security

Description: Researchers from Proofpoint discover a campaign where threat actors put links in YouTube video descriptions allegedly taking victims to other sites where information-stealing malware like Vidar, StealC and Lumma Stealer can be delivered.

Target: Organizations in the oil and gas sector
Description: Researchers from Cofense discover an updated version of an information-stealing malware Rhadamanthys, used in phishing campaigns targeting the oil and gas sector.

Author: Red Ransomware Group (Red CryptoApp)
Description: Researchers at Netenrich uncover a new ransomware group called Red Ransomware Group (Red CryptoApp).

Author: Foreign threat actors
Target: At least 12 MPs in the UK
Description: At least a dozen Westminster insiders are targeted in a WhatsApp phishing attack.
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security

Target: Financial organizations in Malaysia, Vietnam e Myanmar
Description: Researchers from Cyble discover a fake e-shop campaign targeting 18 Malaysian banks with upgraded malicious applications and expanding to banks in Vietnam and Myanmar.

Author: Multiple threat actors
Target: IT help desks across the Healthcare and Public Health (HPH) sector.
Description: The U.S. Department of Health and Human Services (HHS) warns that threat actors are now using social engineering tactics to target IT help desks across the Healthcare and Public Health (HPH) sector.
Google fixes CVE-2024-29745 and CVE-2024-29748, two Google Pixel zero-days exploited by forensic firms to unlock phones without a PIN and gain access to the data stored within them.
SurveyLama suffers a data breach in February 2024, which exposes the sensitive data of 4.4 million users.

Author: Daixin
Description: Omni Hotels & Resorts confirms that an alleged ransomware attack caused a nationwide IT outage that is still affecting its locations. The Daixin Team ransomware claims responsibility for the attack.

Author: Solar Spider
Target: Financial services and organizations in the APAC and MENA regions.
Description: Researchers from Resecurity detect a new version of JSOutProx, targeting financial services and organizations in the APAC and MENA regions.

Author: LockBit
Description: Ernest Health rehabilitation hospitals notify patients of a LockBit ransomware attack.

Author: INC Ransom
Description: Otolaryngology Associates notifies 316,802 patients about a ransomware attack.
Researchers from Fortinet discover a campaign using a bogus installers for Adobe Acrobat Reader to distribute a new multi-functional malware dubbed Byakugan.
Researchers from Bitdefender reveal that cybercriminals are taking over Facebook pages and using them to advertise fake generative artificial intelligence software loaded with malware.
Visa warns about a spike in detections for a new version of the JsOutProx malware targeting financial institutions and their customers.

Author: TA577 and TA578
Description: Researchers from Proofpoint and Team Cymru discover a new malware called Latrodectus, believed to be an evolution of the IcedID loader.

Author: CoralRaider
Target: Organizations in India, China, South Korea, Bangladesh, Pakistan, Indonesia
Description: Researchers at Cisco Talos discover a cluster of activity tracked as CoralRaider, carried out by a threat actor of Vietnamese origin, and attacking India, China, South Korea, Bangladesh, Pakistan, Indonesia and domestic targets with the exfiltration malware  RotBot, a customized remote access tool, variant of the Quasar RAT.
Country: BD CN ID IN KR PK VN

Description: Researchers from Perception Point discover a phishing attack using compromised LinkedIn accounts to steal the victims' credentials via the Snake malware.
Researchers from Sansec reveal that threat actors are exploiting CVE-2024-20720, a critical vulnerability in Magento to inject a persistent backdoor into ecommerce websites.

Author: Yunfeng Sun (a.k.a. “Alphonse Sun”) and Hongnam Cheung (a.k.a. “Zhang Hongnim” or “Stanford Fischer”)
Description: Two China-based Android app developers are sued by Google for an alleged scam targeting 100,000 users worldwide through fake cryptocurrency and other investment apps.

Researchers from AhnLab discover a campaign targeting users of the popular text and code editor, Notepad++ carried out manipulating “mimeTools.dll,” a standard component of Notepad++ that provides encoding functionalities, such as Base64.

Author: MuddyWater a.k.a. Boggy Serpens, Mango Sandstorm, and TA450
Description: Researchers from Deep Instinct reveal that the Iranian threat actor known as MuddyWater has been attributed to a new command-and-control (C2) infrastructure called DarkBeatC2

Author: UNC5221, UNC5266, UNC5330, UNC5337, UNC5291 (associated to Volt Typhoon)
Description: Researchers from Google Mandiant reveal that several China-based hacking groups, including Volt Typhoon, are targeting a trio of vulnerabilities affecting Ivanti.

Author: RGB-TEAM
Description: A group of hacktivists going by the name RGB-TEAM claims responsibility for hacking into the website of Russia’s prosecutor general, exposing data on criminal offenses committed in Russia over the past 30 years.
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security

Author: LockBit and DragonForce
Description: The government of Palau is hit with an alleged ransomware attack by the LockBit and DragonForce ransomware gangs.
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security

Description: Pacific Guardian Life Insurance says that 165,000 people had their financial info stolen in 2023 attack.

Author: China
Description: Researchers at Microsoft reveal that China-linked influence operations have begun to use generative artificial intelligence to amplify controversial domestic issues in places like the U.S. and Taiwan.
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security

Description: The NorthBay VacaValley Hospital in California is forced to turn some patients away due to a ransomware attack.
Threat actors break into the computer network of the Florida Department of Juvenile Justice.
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security

Author: Nation-state threat actors
Description: The German Federal Office for Information Security, or BSI, and the Federal Office for the Protection of the Constitution warn that phishing attacks targeting political parties surged ahead of upcoming European Union elections.
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security

Author: ph1ns
Target: Filipino Department of Science and Technology
Description: In name of #OpEDSA, a Filipino hacktivist group operating under the pseudonym "ph1ns," breaks into servers owned and operated by the government's Department of Science and Technology and deletes up to 25 terabytes of confidential data and backups.
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security

Author: Medusa
Description: The Traverse City Area Public Schools are hit with a Medusa ransomware attack.
Researchers at Malwarebytes discover a campaign using a Bing advertisement designed to look like a link to install NordVPN leading to an installer for the remote access trojan SecTopRAT.
Researchers from Trustwave discover a new phishing campaign targeting organizations in the Latin American region to deliver malicious payloads to Windows systems.
Panera Bread suffers a ransomware attack.
Greylock McKinnon Associates reports a data breach, telling victims that personal information like Social Security numbers and more were accessed during an incident last May.

The University of Winnipeg in Canada confirms that threat actors stole sensitive information from the institution in an incident that took place late last month, affecting former and current students and staff.

Author: ShopifyGUY
Description: A threat actor, with the moniker "ShopifyGUY," leaks personal information belonging to 7.5 million of customers of boAt, a consumer electronics company in India.

Author: RGB
Description: The Russian language fan club forum for the cybersecurity giant Kaspersky (forum.kasperskyclub.ru) experiences a data breach, during which a hacker group known as RGB leaks the personal data of 56,798 users online.

Author: RGB
Target: Prosecutor’s Office of the Russian Federation (epp.genproc.gov.ru)
Description: The RGB group, self-identifying as a hacktivist collective, also has asserts responsibility for breaching the Prosecutor’s Office of the Russian Federation (epp.genproc.gov.ru). To substantiate their claim, the group leaked an Excel file containing precisely 100,000 lines of information about criminal cases from 2013.
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security

Author: Vedalia (a.k.a. Konni)
Description: Researchers from Broadcom reveal that the Vedalia Advanced Persistent Threat (APT) group, also known by its alias Konni, has been distributing malware using an innovative technique involving oversized LNK files.

Author: IntelBroker
Description: Home Depot confirms that it suffered a data breach after one of its SaaS vendors mistakenly exposed a small sample of limited employee data, which could potentially be used in targeted phishing attacks.

Researchers from Fortinet observe a threat actor sending out a phishing email containing malicious Scalable Vector Graphics (SVG) files, crafted to trick recipients into clicking on an attachment. The attachment downloads a ZIP file containing a Batch file obfuscated with the BatCloak tool. Then the attackers use ScrubCrypt to load the final payload VenomRAT.
Almost 2,000 hacked WordPress sites display fake NFT and discount pop-ups to trick visitors into connecting their wallets to crypto drainers that automatically steal funds.
UK veterinary services provider CVS Group announces that it suffered a cyberattack that disrupted IT services at its practices across the country.
Laptop and tablet accessories maker Targus discloses that it suffered a cyberattack disrupting operations after a threat actor gained access to the company's file servers.
Paris Saint-Germain (PSG), the Qatari-owned football team, informs its supporters that a cyberattack targeted the club’s online ticketing service

Author: Blackjack
Description: The Blackjack hackers, together with the SBU Cyber Department, destroy more than 300 TB of data from the Russian data center OwenCloud.ru, which was used by the Russian military-industrial complex, oil and gas, and telecom. The destruction of the Russian cloud service is allegedly made in retaliation for the attack on the Ukrainian data center Parkovy in January this year.

Author: Muliaka
Description: Researchers from F.A.C.C.T. discover Muliaka, a previously unknown ransomware gang attacking Russian businesses with malware based on the leaked source code from the Conti group.

Author: RUBYCARP
Description: Researchers from Sysdig discover a long-running botnet operated by a Romanian threat actor group, dubbed RUBYCARP, launching multiple attacks such as phishing and crypto miners.

Author: Starry Addax
Target: Human rights activists in Morocco and the Western Sahara
Description: Researchers from Cisco Talos discover "Starry Addax”, a threat actor targeting mostly human rights activists associated with the Sahrawi Arab Democratic Republic (SADR) cause with FlexStarling, a novel mobile malware.
Researchers from ThreatDown distributing the Nitrogen malware via fraudulent ads for popular system utilities like PuTTY and FileZilla.
Microsoft patches CVE-2024-29988, a SmartScreen Prompt Security Feature Bypass vulnerability exploited in the wild.
Microsoft patches CVE-2024-26234, a Proxy Driver Spoofing vulnerability exploited in the wild.

Author: Muddled Libra (a.k.a. Scatter Swine, Scattered Spider, Starfraud, and UNC3944)
Description: Researchers from Palo Alto Networks observe the threat actor known as Muddled Libra actively targeting software-as-a-service (SaaS) applications and cloud service provider (CSP) environments in a bid to exfiltrate sensitive data.

Researchers from Binary Defense reveal that attackers are now leveraging encrypted phishing emails that utilize Scalable Vector Graphics (SVG) files to execute malicious JavaScript code starting with an email masquerading as a notification for a new voice message.

Target: Group Health Cooperative of South Central Wisconsin (GHC-SCW)
Description: Non-profit healthcare service provider Group Health Cooperative of South Central Wisconsin (GHC-SCW) discloses that a ransomware gang breached its network in January and stole documents containing the personal and medical information of over 500,000 individuals.
GBI Genios, a database company used by numerous media organizations in Germany, announces its servers are unavailable “due to a massive hacker attack.”

Author: BlackSuit
Description: East Central University in Ada, Oklahoma, announces that it is investigating a BlackSuit ransomware attack that took place in February.
Researchers from HP discover new campaigns distributing Raspberry Robin via Windows Script Files (WSF).
Researchers from Checkmarx reveal that threat actors have been observed manipulating GitHub search results to infect developers with persistent malware.

Author: TA547 a.k.a. Scully Spider
Target: Dozens of organizations across various industries in Germany
Description: Researchers from Proofpoint identify the threat actor TA547 targeting German organizations with an email campaign delivering the Rhadamanthys malware.
Apple sends threat notifications to iPhone users in 92 countries, warning them that they may have been targeted by mercenary spyware attacks.

Target: Users in South Asia, particularly those in India and Pakistan
Description: Researchers from ESET discover eXotic Visit, an active espionage campaign targeting Android users with apps primarily posing as messaging services bundled with the open-source XploitSPY malware.
LastPass reveals that threat actors targeted one of its employees in a voice phishing attack, using deepfake audio to impersonate Karim Toubba, the company's Chief Executive Officer.
New Mexico Highlands University (NMHU) is forced to cancel all classes after suffering a ransomware attack.

Author: Blackjack
Description: Blackjack, a Ukrainian hacker group affiliated with the country’s security service claims to have targeted Moskollector, the firm that operates the communication system for Moscow’s sewage network.
CCM Health inform patients that protected health information (PHI) may have been accessed and exfiltrated during an attack that occurred between April 3 – April 10, 2023.

Author: Earth Hundun (a.k.a. BlackTech)
Target: Technology, research, and government sectors in the Asia-Pacific region
Description: Researchers at Trend Micro observe a surge in cyberattacks targeting a number of organizations in various sectors such as technology, research, and government in the Asia-Pacific region, involving a malware family known as  Waterbear.
U.S. cybersecurity agency CISA warns Sisense customers to reset their credentials and secrets after the data analytics company reported a security incident.
Researchers from Sucuri discover a credit card skimmer concealed within a fake Meta Pixel tracker script in an attempt to evade detection.

The U.S. Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Security Agency (CISA) adds the following D-Link multiple NAS devices flaws, CVE-2024-3272 and CVE-2024-3273, to its Known Exploited Vulnerabilities (KEV) catalog.
Researchers from Phylum reveal that the popular Rust crate known as liblzma-sys has been compromised with the  XZ Utils backdoor.

Researchers from Recorded Future discover a large-scale Russian-language cybercrime operation using fake Web3 gaming initiatives to distribute malware, such as Atomic macOS Stealer (AMOS), Stealc, Rhadamanthys, or RisePro designed, to steal information from both macOS and Windows users.
Researchers from Cyble uncover a novel phishing campaign tailored to cryptocurrency users with the well-known FatalRAT along with additional malware such as Clipper and Keylogger.
Researchers from Blackberry discover a "renewed" cyber espionage campaign targeting users in South Asia with the aim of delivering an Apple iOS spyware variant of LightSpy, called "F_Warehouse".

Researchers from Forescout reveal the details of 'Connect:fun', an exploitation campaign targeting organizations running Fortinet’s FortiClient EMS, vulnerable to CVE-2023-48788 and deploying ScreenConnect and Powerfun as post-exploitation tools.
Researchers from AhnLab discover a campaign installing the Metasploit Meterpreter backdoor via the Redis service.

Author: LockBit
Target: Municipalities of Saint-Nazaire, Montoir-de-Bretagne, Donges, La Chapelle-des-marais and Pornichet
Description: Five municipalities near the river Loire on the west coast of France are hit by a LockBit ransomware attack on their shared computer servers, leaving staff without the ability to access documents or get on with their work.
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security

Description: The Federal Bureau of Investigation warns of a massive ongoing wave of SMS phishing attacks targeting Americans with lures regarding unpaid road toll fees.

Author: Blackjack
Target: Emergency detection and response capabilities in Moscow
Description: Researchers from Claroty report that the Ukrainian Blackjack group claims to have damaged emergency detection and response capabilities in Moscow and beyond the Russian capital using a destructive ICS malware dubbed Fuxnet.
Roku warns that 576,000 accounts were hacked in new credential stuffing attacks after disclosing another incident that compromised 15,000 accounts in early March.

Author: Dark Angels
Description: Dutch chipmaker Nexperia confirms that threat actors breached its network in March 2024 after the Dark Angels ransomware gang leaked samples of allegedly stolen data.

Author: State-sponsored threat actors?
Description: Conservative think tank The Heritage Foundation says that it experienced a cyberattack.
Insurance and banking conglomerate Suncorp is dealing with a cyberattack in which an intruder has accessed some customers’ bank balances and withdrawn funds.

Author: UTA0218
Description: Researchers from Palo Alto Networks reveal the details of Operation MidnightEclipse, the exploitation of the newly disclosed zero-day flaw in Palo Alto Networks PAN-OS software, CVE-2024-3400 Vulnerability, since March 26, 2024, nearly three weeks before it came to light yesterday.

Author: Handala
Description: An Iranian cyber group named Handala claims to have breached Israel's radar systems and sent hundreds of thousands of threatening text messages to Israeli citizens.
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security

Description: Researchers at the OpenJS Foundation stop a “credible” takeover attempt to compromise one of its popular JavaScript projects.

Author: LockBit variant
Description: Researchers from Kaspersky reveal the details of an incident occurred using a customized version of the LockBit ransomware built with the leaked LockBit builder.

Author: TA558
Description: Researchers from Positive Technologies reveal the details of "SteganoAmor", a campaign launched by the threat actor TA558 concealing malicious code inside images using steganography to deliver various malware tools onto targeted systems.
Cisco Duo's security team warns that threat actors stole some customers' VoIP and SMS logs for multi-factor authentication (MFA) messages in a cyberattack on their telephony provider.

Author: Cyber Resistance
Description: Ukrainian hackers from Cyber Resistance claim to have breached the Russian drone developer Albatross, leaking 100 gigabytes of data, including internal documentation, technical data and drawings of various types of unmanned aerial vehicles.

Target: Android users in U.S., India and Taiwan
Description: Researchers from Veriti discover a surge in attacks from operators of the Androxgh0st malware family, uncovering over 600 servers compromised primarily in the U.S., India and Taiwan.
